node.title: Residents told to say indoors as fire engulfs linen factory in Perth's east
node.description: Residents living near a factory fire in Perth's east are advised to stay indoors to avoid plumes of smoke and fumes filling the sky.Â
node.content:
["Residents living near a factory fire in Perth's east have been advised to stay indoors after the blaze was upgraded to a hazmat incident.\u00a0", "Firefighters are battling the fire at the Atlas Linen\u00a0factory in Belmont, which has caused huge plumes of smoke to fill the sky.", "The fire started on Alexander Road, near the intersection of Abernethy Road, at about\u00a06:30am.", "Authorities have advised residents within 500 metres\u00a0to remain inside and keep doors and windows closed and air conditioners switched off.\u00a0", "Motorists have also been asked to avoid the area, reduce speed and drive carefully as crews try to contain and control the fire.\u00a0", "", "
The fire caused huge plumes of smoke to fill the sky.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Residents in Belmont and nearby suburbs have posted photos of the fire online, showing huge plumes of smoke billowing from the roof of the building.", "Some have commented saying they could \"smell something like chemicals\" in the air.\u00a0", "", "
Nearby residents have been warned to avoid going outside.\u00a0(Supplied: Fiona Budgen)
", "Emergency services fear the fire may spread to other\u00a0businesses near the factory, including a shooting range and a pet shop.", "Abernethy Road has been closed from Campbell Street to Alexander Road.\u00a0", "The cause of the fire is yet to be determined."]
